title: Suspect arrested in deadly drive-by shooting of 5-year-old Cleveland boy
content:
(Cory Shaffer, Northeast Ohio Media Group)
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- The suspect in Friday's deadly drive-by shooting that killed 5-year-old Ramon Burnett was arrested Saturday afternoon.
Marlon Hackett Jr., 19, turned himself in at the Cuyahoga County Justice Center about 2:30 p.m. after he was charged with aggravated murder.
Police accused Hackett of shooting into a crowd of people gathered inside a housing complex at Louise Harris Drive and Central Avenue Friday.
Hackett was targeting an 18-year-old man, but the bullet he fired struck Ramon in the chest, according to court documents.
Hackett will likely be arraigned in Cleveland Municipal Court Tuesday morning.
